intro: Xyphostylis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Americas. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grasses. Xyphostylis angustifolia is often found in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
